definition: to work hard/to do one's very best/to throw oneself into the task at hand
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
surname Li
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
to make a living doing manual labor/to give sth all one's got

sentences.english: He worked hard, though still poor in health.
sentences.chinese: 他固然身体不好，可是任务起来很卖力气。

sentences.english: Mr. Li was gung-ho about his new job.
sentences.chinese: 李先生对他的新工作很卖力。

sentences.english: The mechanics went places on the damaged car; still they didn't fix it before the boss came back.
sentences.chinese: 修理工卖力修那破车，可是老板回来了他们仍没修好。

sentences.english: The harder we work, the easier it is for us to finish.
sentences.chinese: 我们干的越卖力，完成的就越轻松。

sentences.english: He really went at the job of painting the wall.
sentences.chinese: 他确实卖力地干粉墙的工作。

sentences.english: The team played very hard, but could not get out of the hole .
sentences.chinese: 该队打得很卖力，但仍然不能打成平手。

sentences.english: Third, he had flexible flesh to work well.
sentences.chinese: 他有柔韧的肌肉来卖力工作。
他们俩都干得非常卖力。

sentences.english: She has always worked hard at collective jobs.
sentences.chinese: 集体的活她一向于得很卖力。

sentences.english: In fact, having a good system only incentivizes good employees to work for your company.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，良好的体制只会激励员工为公司卖力。

sentences.english: The horse that draw most, it's most whipped.
sentences.chinese: 最卖力拉车的马，挨鞭子最多。

sentences.english: When you really like what you’re doing, you work very hard at it.
sentences.chinese: 当你确实喜欢你所做的事情时，你就会很卖力地去做。

sentences.english: This time he is going to do his utmost to make amends for the failure last time.
sentences.chinese: 这次任务他格外卖力，想将功折罪以弥补上次的失败。

sentences.english: The manager threatened his men with dismissal in order to bully them into working harder.
sentences.chinese: 经理以解雇来威胁职工，迫使他们更卖力气。

sentences.english: From all the breathless speculation you'd think that was on the cards.
sentences.chinese: 从所有卖力的推测中，你所考虑的是可能的。

sentences.english: The job doesn't really challenge him.
sentences.chinese: 他确实卖力地干粉墙的工作。

definition: to do one's utmost/with all one's might/at all costs/(to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it
vigorously/energetically/enthusiastically
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to be willing to do sth/to be ready to do sth/to be happy to do sth/content/satisfied
industrious and conscientious/assiduous
to discharge one's duties/conscientious
to shout/to bawl/to yell (to urge on an animal)/to hawk (one's wares)/to denounce loudly/to shout slogans
to applaud/to clap
to acclaim/to cheer
diligent/hardworking
(dialect) to be full of zeal/high-spirited/exhilarating/to stir sb up
continuously/persistently/incessantly
responsible and diligent (idiom)
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
